title: Making sense of all things data
summary: In this blog, Abel Sanchez, the executive director and research director of MIT’s Geospatial Data Center, discusses the challenges and potential of digital transformation in utilizing data for business decision-making. He highlights the abundance and complexity of data being produced from various sources, making it difficult for individuals to effectively use it. Sanchez emphasizes the need for a new approach to data storage and accessibility, suggesting a shift towards a modern stack that democratizes information and enables better decision-making. He also introduces blockchain technology as a new player in data coordination, explaining its potential to improve efficiency and productivity by providing a global platform for identity, currency, and logic. Sanchez provides examples of how blockchain can be applied in industries such as healthcare and agriculture to streamline processes and create value. Overall, he emphasizes the importance of embracing digital transformation and leveraging data to optimize operations and drive profitability.
